prompt:
Task: For each ingredient, choose the best Woolworths SKU (from candidates) and suggest how many retail packs are needed.
        Use servings + archetype context to keep quantities realistic. If no candidate fits, set selected_product_id to null and explain in package_notes.
        Do NOT rewrite the instructions or mention retailer names in the method; only provide product matches.

        Archetype snapshot:
        ```json
        {
  "uid": "arch_1k7p9f",

      "Vegan",
      "HighProtein"
    ],

      "Indian",
      "SouthAfrican"
    ],
    "CuisineOpenness": [
      "FamiliarClassics"
    ],
    "PrepTime": [
      "15to30"
    ],
    "Complexity": [
      "Simple"
    ],
    "HeatSpice": [
      "NoHeat"
    ],
    "Audience": [
      "Family"
    ],
    "BudgetLevel": [
      "Affordable"
    ],
    "EthicsReligious": [
      "JainFriendly"
    ],
    "Allergens": []
  }
}
        ```

        Meal draft:
        ```json
        {
  "name": "Tomato-Lentil Cabbage Stew with Soft Pap (Jain-Friendly)",
  "description": "A mild, hearty lentil and cabbage tomato stew finished with a cumin tempering, served alongside soft maize meal pap. Vegan, Jain-friendly, and family-focused with no heat.",
  "servings": "Serves 4",
  "prep_steps": [
    "Rinse lentils under cold water until water runs clear.",
    "Shred cabbage into thin strips.",
    "Roughly chop coriander leaves.",
    "Measure maize meal and water for pap.",
    "Measure diced tomatoes, peas, sunflower oil, cumin seeds, turmeric, and salt."
  ],
  "cook_steps": [
    "Make pap: Bring 6 cups water and a pinch of salt to a boil in a pot. Whisk in 2 cups maize meal gradually to avoid lumps, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 15–20 minutes, stirring occasionally until soft.",
    "Cook lentils: In a separate pot, combine lentils, 4 cups water, turmeric, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then simmer 12–15 minutes until just tender.",
    "Add diced tomatoes, cabbage, and peas to the lentils. Simmer 5–8 minutes until cabbage is tender and stew thickens. Adjust salt to taste.",
    "Temper cumin: Heat sunflower oil in a small pan on medium. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle 30–45 seconds until fragrant. Pour the tempered oil over the stew and stir.",
    "Fluff pap and divide among plates. Ladle the stew alongside and garnish with coriander."
  ],
  "ingredients": [
    {
      "core_item_name": "maize meal",
      "quantity": "2 cups"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "water",
      "quantity": "10 cups total",
      "preparation": "6 cups for pap, 4 cups for stew"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "lentils",
      "quantity": "1.5 cups",
      "preparation": "rinsed"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "diced tomatoes",
      "quantity": "1 can (about 400 g)"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "cabbage",
      "quantity": "2 cups",
      "preparation": "shredded"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "peas",
      "quantity": "1 cup",
      "preparation": "frozen or fresh"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "turmeric",
      "quantity": "1 teaspoon"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "cumin seeds",
      "quantity": "1.5 teaspoons"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "sunflower oil",
      "quantity": "2 tablespoons"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "salt",
      "quantity": "1 to 1.5 teaspoons",
      "preparation": "to taste"
    },
    {
      "core_item_name": "coriander",
      "quantity": "1/4 cup",
      "preparation": "chopped leaves"
    }
  ],
  "meal_tags": {
    "Diet": [
      "HighProtein",
      "Vegan"
    ],
    "Cuisine": [
      "Indian",
      "SouthAfrican"
    ],
    "PrepTime": [
      "15to30"
    ],
    "Complexity": [
      "Simple"
    ],
    "HeatSpice": [
      "NoHeat"
    ],
    "EthicsReligious": [
      "JainFriendly"
    ],
    "BudgetLevel": [
      "Affordable"
    ],
    "Audience": [
      "Family"
    ],
    "CuisineOpenness": [
      "FamiliarClassics"
    ],
    "NutritionFocus": [
      "HighProtein"
    ]
  }
}
        ```
